title: Build Core Gameplay
purpose: Describe the core function Build Core Gameplay.
guardrails: Adhere strictly to approved requirements; avoid adding unplanned features or scope creep
Follow coding standards and maintain a modular architecture to facilitate future integration
Use profiling tools and optimization only where necessary; avoid premature or speculative optimization
Ensure cross‑platform compatibility as specified by the design document
Document all interfaces, APIs, and assumptions in the repository
Keep networking features minimal; do not build full multiplayer services
Respect resource budgets for CPU, GPU, memory, and storage
Do not alter core design pillars without stakeholder sign‑off

tasks.title: Assess prototype and finalize requirements, refactoring architecture for scalability/modularity.
tasks.description: Review the prototype, finalize requirements, and refactor the architecture for scalability and modularity.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet listing finalized functional and non-functional requirements with status, owner, and verification method.

acceptance.text: Lists all agreed-upon requirements with unique IDs and descriptions.
Includes status, owner, and verification method for each requirement.
Signed off by product and technical leads.

deliverables.description: Report identifying gaps between prototype capabilities and final requirements, including recommendations to address them.

acceptance.text: Highlights differences between prototype and requirements.
Includes recommendations and prioritization.
Reviewed by cross-disciplinary leads.

deliverables.description: Document presenting the refactored system architecture with diagrams and explanations for scalability and modularity.

acceptance.text: Architecture diagrams updated to reflect scalable and modular design.
Explains key components, interfaces, and data flows.
Reviewed and accepted by technical architect.

tasks.title: Implement advanced mechanics, physics, networking stubs, and input handling.
tasks.description: Develop and integrate advanced mechanics, physics interactions, networking stubs, and robust input handling.

deliverables.description: Code modules implementing advanced gameplay mechanics and physics interactions with documentation.

acceptance.text: Implements advanced mechanics as defined in the design document.
Integrated with physics engine and passes unit tests.
Documentation included for functions and classes.

deliverables.description: Package containing networking stubs and advanced input handling code integrated into the project.

acceptance.text: Includes stubbed networking components ready for later expansion.
Implements robust input handling with multi-device support.
Compiles without errors and passes integration tests.

tasks.title: Optimize performance and develop diagnostic/debugging tools.
tasks.description: Optimize game performance and create diagnostic tools to assist developers in monitoring key metrics.

deliverables.description: Report detailing performance profiling results, optimization steps taken, and their impact on key metrics across platforms.

acceptance.text: Uses profiling tools to identify bottlenecks.
Documents optimizations and resulting performance improvements.
Shows metrics meeting or exceeding targets (e.g., 30 or 60 FPS).

deliverables.description: A diagnostic/debug overlay tool or module that can be toggled on/off to display real-time metrics and logs.

acceptance.text: Debug overlay displays real-time metrics (FPS, memory usage, etc.).
Can be toggled on/off without affecting gameplay.
Code is documented and integrated into the build.

tasks.title: Conduct comprehensive unit and integration testing.
tasks.description: Develop a comprehensive suite of unit and integration tests, and measure coverage to ensure code quality.

deliverables.description: Collection of automated unit and integration tests covering core gameplay systems.

acceptance.text: Includes tests for all critical components and mechanics.
Runs on CI and passes in target environments.
Covers edge cases and error conditions.

deliverables.description: Code coverage report summarizing the percentage of code executed by tests, highlighting uncovered areas.

acceptance.text: Achieves at least 90% coverage across modules.
Highlights remaining uncovered areas with rationale.
Generated automatically as part of CI.

tasks.title: Compile a core mechanics validation report.
tasks.description: Validate the core mechanics through testing and document the results in a comprehensive report.

deliverables.description: Validation report summarizing playtest results, metrics, and expert reviews confirming that core mechanics meet performance and quality criteria.

acceptance.text: Summarizes validation experiments and metrics for each core mechanic.
Confirms mechanics meet design goals and performance targets.
Reviewed and approved by design and technical leads.

tasks.title: Freeze core gameplay module for handoff.
tasks.description: Prepare and deliver the frozen core gameplay module for downstream integration.

deliverables.description: Finalized and frozen build of the core gameplay module ready for integration, including compiled binaries and source code.

acceptance.text: Runs without critical bugs on target platforms.
Matches finalized requirements and design documents.
Tagged and archived in version control.

tasks.title: Document interfaces, APIs, and assumptions in the repository.
tasks.description: Document all interfaces, APIs, and assumptions to support future development and integration.

deliverables.description: Comprehensive documentation of system architecture, public APIs, interfaces, data structures, and underlying assumptions.

acceptance.text: Documentation covers all major modules and their interfaces.
Includes usage examples and diagrams.
Approved by technical lead and accessible in repository.
